name: medusa_parallel_bruteforce
description: Parallel network login bruteforce using Medusa (alternative to Hydra)

expected_output.example:
Medusa v2.2 parallel login bruteforcer
ACCOUNT FOUND: [{{service}}] Host: {{target}} User: admin Password: admin123
ACCOUNT FOUND: [{{service}}] Host: {{target}} User: root Password: toor
ACCOUNT CHECK: [{{service}}] Host: {{target}} (1000 of 10000 complete)
2 valid credentials found

Single user brute (admin) with -f (exit on first found)
ACCOUNT FOUND: [ssh] Host: {{target}} User: admin Password: password123
Stopped after first valid credential

Results logging to medusa_output.txt
5 accounts tested
3 passwords found
Output file created with timestamp

Multi-target attack from targets.txt
Host 192.168.1.100: 2 accounts found
Host 192.168.1.101: 1 account found
Host 192.168.1.102: 0 accounts found
Total: 3 credentials across 3 hosts

Available modules:
 + ssh.mod : Brute force module for SSH v2
 + ftp.mod : Brute force module for FTP/FTPS
 + rdp.mod : Brute force module for RDP
 + smb.mod : Brute force module for SMB
